summary: Although the U.S. food supply is generally considered safe, foodborne illness remains a costly, common public health problem. The safety and quality of the food supply is governed by a system administered by 16 federal agencies. For example, one agency regulates frozen cheese pizzas, another agency regulates frozen pizzas with meat, and additional agencies regulate components of both. Food safety and government performance experts agree...
title: Food Safety: A National Strategy Is Needed to Address Fragmentation in Federal Oversight
